meanings.def: behaviour or an event that people think is morally or legally wrong and causes public feelings of shock or anger
examples: The scandal broke (= became known to the public) in May.
There has been no hint of scandal during his time in office.
a promising career wrecked by scandal
In the wake of recent accounting scandals, new cases have come to light.
The apartment was paid for by the bank at the centre of the scandal.
There have been calls for the resignation of the minister involved in the sex scandal.

meanings.def: talk or reports about the very bad or wrong things that people have done or are thought to have done
examples: The newspapers are full of scandal about her private life.
Their relationship attracted a lot of scandal.
She's always trying to stir up scandal.

meanings.def: an action, attitude, etc. that you think is very wrong and not at all acceptable
examples: it is a scandal that… It is a scandal that such a large city has no orchestra.
The real scandal is that nothing has been done to make sure it doesn't happen again.
